title: Gujarat Giants Finally Break Through: Beth Mooney, Laura Wolvaardt Power Win Over RCB in WPL 2024
content:
The Gujarat Giants finally secured their first win of the Women's Premier League 2024 season, defeating the Royal Challengers Bangalore by 19 runs in a thrilling encounter at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi. 

The Giants' victory was powered by a magnificent 140-run opening partnership between Beth Mooney (85*) and Laura Wolvaardt (76), the second-highest in the tournament's history. Their impressive display helped Gujarat set a mammoth target of 200 runs for Bangalore, a target they could only manage to chase down to 180/8. 

The Royal Challengers, despite valiant efforts from Smriti Mandhana, Ellyse Perry, Sophie Devine, and Richa Ghosh, struggled to keep pace with the required run-rate and ultimately fell short of the target. The win catapulted the Gujarat Giants into the top four, while the Royal Challengers Bangalore remain in second place.
author: Scroll Staff
